Body: I am living in India and my uncle gave me a brand new MOTxt912 verizon phone but I have inserted a non verizon sim and there is no signal and I got the following error message "This sim card is from unknown source". I have enabled the GSM band with the help of following thread http://www.dhakamobile.com/showthread.php?p=345399. But I couldn't get rid of the Error message. I read in some forums that Uninstalling the Verizon app may fix this issue. Is there any method to remove verizon app?Note: I couldnot enable the USB debugging as the access to phone menu is prevented by the same popup.
Title: The sim card is from unknown source - MOTXT912

history.Text: I am living in India and my uncle gave me a brand new MOTxt912 verizon phone but I have inserted a non verizon sim and there is no signal and I got the following error message "This sim card is from unknown source". I have enabled the GSM band with the help of following thread http://www.dhakamobile.com/showthread.php?p=345399. But I couldn't get rid of the Error message. I read in some forums that Uninstalling the Verizon app may fix this issue. Is there any method to remove verizon app?Note: I couldnot enable the USB debugging as the access to phone menu is prevented by the same popup.
The sim card is from unknown source - MOTXT912
